Metadata: "Coastal Zone '95," ASCE, Billy L. Edge (ed.), pp. 282-283, 1995.

Encouraging educators to adopt novel teaching methods that foster a sense of environmental stewardship among their students is the theme of a video developed by the Sea Grant programs of the University of Hawaii and the University of Southern California. An innovative environmental education program, called the "Adopt A Beach School Assembly Program," is highlighted. The purpose of the video is to introduce educators to a new means of integrating classroom education and hands-on learning through community service. The program shows how students discover that they can make a difference in the world in which they live through recycling and community involvement. A resource list of easily accessible marine and environmental education materials is included as part of the video.
